title: release: 0.2.6
body: ## Release v0.2.6

title: fix: Fixed delegated pda only with rent exempt balance
body: Closes #33

title: Pinocchio Feature
body:
With this Delegation Program become available for those that want to develop in Pinocchio.

Some considerations:
- Due to the use of Vecs, no_allocator! in the Pinocchio entrypoint is not allowed
- The code should be improved to avoid Vecs and clone in order to follow Pinocchio principles by using zero copy and avoid heap allocations.
- In this code I implemented a custom serialization to avoid Borsh but we can easily revert back to borsh.
- All the instructions are in the instruction folder but I can store them as per SDK example
- All instructions and helpers have been updated to use Pinocchio structs and implementations

Let me know what changes you want to see and I shall do them but this is pretty much an re-implementation of the SDK to Pinocchio.

title: Implementation of dynamic routing table
body: Now, in addition to user provided routing table (which is now optional) the resolver will attempt to fetch all node records from domain registry and maintain an up to date list of those records, so the routing table can be changed on the fly when if nodes connect or disconnect from network.

title: Update solana and anchor dependencies (#24)
body: ## Update solana and anchor dependencies

title: Remove upper bound constraint for solana and anchor dependency
body: Remove upper bound constraint for solana and anchor dependency with the new release of anchor 0.31.0 which allows the usage of solana program 2 and above.

title: chore: minor cleanups after delegation program changes
body:
## Summary

Following changes in the delegation program I take another look at the SDK:
- remove the capabilities for calling allow_undelegate IX that does not exist anymore
- fix some minor bug in the delegate_args.rs
- clarify naming in the typescript code

Follow up of this PR: https://github.com/magicblock-labs/delegation-program/pull/58

title: feat: add resolver module to typescript implementation of sdk
feat: add magic-resolver to rust workspace
chore: cleanup seed to PDA code
body:
## Summary

This was already changed in the delegation program itself, but we can simplify/clarify the Pubkey generator functions

## Details

This PR also removes the "undelegation" typescript IX since this is now impossible to undelegate manually from main chain (the validator must initiate the undelegation from inside the ER)

title: chore: remove valid_until
body:
## Summary

Removing the valid_until parameter to the delegation record and delegation IX.

## Details

This used to be an attack vector, removed in PR: https://github.com/magicblock-labs/delegation-program/pull/55

title: Restructure the project based on the implementation language
body: As we are planning to expand the SDK, it's reasonable to alter the structure of repository, to make it easier to navigate. This PR segregates the codebase depending on implementation language, and changes the structure of rust workspace to make it more idiomatic.

title: feat: update delegation dependency and simplify usage
body:
## feat: update delegation dependency and simplify usage

- Update delegation program dependency
- Simplify usage and delegation API
- Introduced Anchor helpers

## Notes

- Since this is a breaking version and the delegation program has not yet been deployed, the crate is temporarily published at `ephemeral-rollups-sdk-v2`

- Similarly, the ts sdk is published at `@magicblock-labs/ephemeral-rollups-sdk-v2`

## Issues

Closes #6
